alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 8:04AM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1009 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 1009 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 804 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain continuing. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past 12 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain and runoff will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Diego, Coronado, Chula Vista, Imperial Beach, El Cajon, National City, La Mesa, Alpine, Pine Valley, and Julian. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
